result.execSummary:
The defendant David LeRoy Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David LeRoy Brown is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David LeRoy Brown was found guilty of Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.
  • David LeRoy Brown was found guilty of Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: to re-instate payment plan - APPROVED by Judge
Judge Stenz reinstated payment plan one last time

Defendant David LeRoy Brown in court with attorney Steven Michael Lucareli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 8:58 AM. State - all matters resolved. Lucareli - 15CT20 - plead to only count with a $500 plus costs; 15CM107 - count #1 - amend count #1 to county ordinance of DC with motor vehicle with a forfeiture of $500.00 plus costs, #2 - dismiss; 15CM112 - count #1 - plead NC as alleged,  withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months  - concurrent to Dodge County case with conditions of: 30 days in FC jail - consecutive to Dodge County case, #2 - amend to county ordinance of DC with $500 forfeiture plus costs, #3 - plead to as alleged - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months, concurrent to count #1, with conditions of costs only; 15CM157 - count #1 - amend to county ordinance of DC with forfeiture of $1000 plus costs, count #2 - amend to county ordinance of DC with forfeiture of $1000 fine plus costs, DRI remaining counts - (#3 - #7); 15CM180 - plead to OAR (count #!) and one BJ (#3) with court costs only on each count and dismiss remaining counts. State has complied with victim notification requirements and one victim is present in the Courtroom with no VIS and victim in Court does not wish to make a statement today. Lucareli mentions 28 days credit on 15CM180/15CM157. Court reviews Dodge County case in CCAP and will consider credit if revoked. Court  - 15CM107 - dismiss count #2, amend count #1 to county ordinance of DC with motor vehicle, pleads NC, finds G, forfeiture of $1000.00 plus costs - take bond posted - remainder due in 60 days/CO; 15CM157 - amend count #1 to county ordinance of DC, pleads NC, finds G, #2 - amend to county ordinance of DC, pleads NC, finds G, forfeitures of $1000.00 plus costs - apply any bond posted - remainder due in 90 days/CO, dismiss counts #3 thru #7; 15CT20 - pleads NC to only count; 15CM112 - amend count #2 to county ordinance of DC, pleads NC, finds G, forfeiture of $500 plus costs - 120 DTP/CO, pleads NC to count #1 as alleged and pleads NC to count #3 as alleged; 15CM180 - pleads NC to count #1 as alleged and pleads NC to count #3 as alleged, court dismisses counts #2, #4, #5 and #6. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing, follow joint recommendation. Lucareli makes final argument prior to sentencing, follow joint recommendation. Brown makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CT20 - fine of $500 plus costs - take bond posted - remainder due in 120 days/CO; 15CM112 - count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months with conditons of: 30 days in jail - consecutive to jail time on Dodge County Case #15CT412 - 28 days credit only if revoked - huber allowed , obtain DL, obtain/maintain full time employment/school, no consumption of possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru and domestic abuse program, no operation of a motor vehicle with valid DL, 100 hours of community service, costs, count #3 - costs, 15CM180 - costs only on count #1 - take bond posted - remainder due in 120 days/CO, #3 - costs only - remainder due in 120/days/CO, right to appeal, adjourned.

converting cash bond to a $500 sig bond

Defendant David LeRoy Brown in court with attorney Steven Michael Lucareli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. FTR recorded. Called 15CM157, 15CT20, 15CM112, 15CM107 & 15CM180. Called 10:33 AM. Lucareli makes statement in regards to warrant issued on 12/7/15, indicates he was arrested 12/1/15, informed Stenz he was not here on 12/7/15 due to being incarrcerated in another county but a warrant was issued anyway, has contacted the DA to request modification of bond multiple times, updates court of other case in another county, bond that was posted was borrowed from family members for warrant that was issued on 12/7/15, sent DA email asking for stipulation on modification of bond. State - wasn't aware of incarrceration in Dodge County on 12/7/15 date, warrant was issued due to non appearance, has no comment in regards to conversations with Lucareli and feels motion should have been filed and objects to the modification of bond. Lucareli - Brown was wanted on warrant and under law can appear at anytime. Court - denies motion of modification of bond at this time due to not following proper proceedure.

Attorney Steven Michael Lucareli in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 15CM107, 15CM180, 15CM112, 15CT20 and 15CM157. Called 9:08 AM. State - was just made aware that defendant was picked up on a warrant and is sitting in Dodge County. 15CM180 & 15CM157 hear for INIT appearances, all others were set for FPT. Lucareli suggests adjourning. All cases set for FPT will be set for JT (15CM112, 15CT20 & 15CM107) 15CM112 will be first and others to be scheduled that day as backups. INIT appearance cases to be set for FPT. State asks for a warrant on 15CM180 & 15CM157. Lucareli does not object but asks that bond money not be forfeited. Court issues bench warrant body or $500 on 15CM180 & 15CM157. Bond will not be forfeited at this time.
